metadata.title: CVE-2020-1919 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description: Incorrect bounds calculations in substr_compare could lead to anout-of-bounds read when the second string argument passed in is longer thanthe first. This issue affects HHVM versions prior to 4.56.3, all versionsbetween 4.57.0 and 4.80.1, all versions between 4.81.0 and 4.93.1, andversions 4.94.0, 4.95.0, 4.96.0, 4.97.0, 4.98.0.

criterions.comment: hhvm: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
